1. Aplastic anemia
2. Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
3. Leukemia
4. Lymphoma
5. Infectious mononucleosis
6. HIV-associated immune deficiency
7. Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP)

Please note that these are the top 10 diagnoses based on the provided patient phenotype, and the actual diagnosis may vary depending on further evaluation and laboratory findings. It is essential to consider other possibilities and perform appropriate tests to narrow down the diagnosis.
